comment: The union of two (undirected) hypergraphs (with the same vertex set) represented as ordered pair: If ` <. V , E >. ` and ` <. V , F >. ` are hypergraphs, then ` <. V , E u. F >. ` is a hypergraph (the vertex set stays the same, but the edges from both graphs are kept, possibly resulting in two edges between two vertices). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 27-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 11-Oct-2020.) (Revised by AV, 24-Oct-2021.)
